Good Evening all Parents, Students, and Staff of Westmoreland County Public Schools:

The Westmoreland County School Board held a special called Board Meeting this evening, August 3, 2020. After reviewing current information shared by the Virginia Department of Health, the School Board voted unanimously to open school fully remote for the first nine weeks marking period. The first day of school will still be August 24, 2020, with all students learning remotely. The decision to open remotely is based on the best information available at this time. We will continue to monitor the pandemic situation, and reassess at the end of the nine weeks. Technology distribution days and other information will be announced in the coming days.

"Children With Hair Loss" is an organization that creates wigs for children who have lost their hair due to medical treatments. All of the proceeds from the raffle go to Relay for Life-Northern Neck.

There will be a few more children who will receive wigs thanks to Lezlee and Mrs. Hutt. Also, Relay for Life - Northern Neck will receive a $108.00 donation thanks to the students and staff of Cople Elementary. Way to go, Cople Eagles!

A very special "Thank You" to Mrs. Morgan King for coordinating this event.

PBL aka Project Based Learning, is a way of teaching so students can learn through creating. During the PBL process, students not only learn the content, but they learn how to collaborate with each other, manage their time and responsibilities, and problem solve.

By the end of this science PBL, our students will have learned about sound AND will have created a musical instrument out of at least 5 different recycled materials that can play 3 different pitches. 🎵🥁🎷🎸

Check out some pictures from an instrument building day today. Products are already looking (and sounding) great!
